channel.title: Black screen failure in Power Up
channel.description:
The screen goes black when I try to go past the room where the explosive barrels kill all the Vortigaunts (just before you open the door and climb the ladders in the toxic waste silo within the Power Up chapter).
However, though the screen goes black, the audio's still working and the HUD is still visible. Basically, everything but the 3D models and textures still works, but other than the HUD, the screen remains black.
This is what I've tried:
-mat_specular [0,1] -mem_force_flush [0,1] -mat_fullbright [0,1] -mat_hsv [0,1] -mat_softwarelighting [0,1] -flush -noclip (camera still fails, no matter where I re-enter the map after the door I mentioned earlier) -restart (which worked as far as I did the level again and didn't have the problem until I tried to save it, then I came back with the blank screen right from loading, even though I didn't save on one. I also tried no-clipping to the end after restart. Didn't fix it.) -Reinstalling -Redownloading -Updated my graphics card (Intel Q965/Q963 Express Chipset Family)
It seems that even though I can get past this error, eventually the black screen of death returns by the next save's load.
My friend and I have been playing the hell out of Black Mesa and it's easily the best HL game in the franchise, so let us know what the issue is here so we can finish the damn thing!
PS: I found the pizza.

item.title: Black screen failure in Power Up
item.dc:creator: lexa2
item.description:
ThePizzaExists:

I tried inputing that code into the console, and it had no effect. I’m still experiencing the same glitch.

Does anyone have a solution to this yet?

Forum search could be your friend. Back in the days the game had been released I had been investigating this bug and had come to a conclusion that with older GPUs like Radeon 9500 (i.e. pre-SM2.0 DX9 hardware) or with some crappy Intel “integrated GPUs” the game fails to render fullscreen noise shader properly resulting in totally black screen. Due to a bug in the game engine (in BMS game server dlls, not in Source engine itself) is it impossible to disable noise shader using console variable - it seems that it is simply ignored by the game. But it was possible to kind-a workaround the problem by messing up with a game shader dlls and definition files. I can’t recall exact details now but you could try reading this thread for a possible solution:
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=502093#post502093
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=502137#post502137

The screen goes black when I try to go past the room where the explosive barrels kill all the Vortigaunts (just before you open the door and climb the ladders in the toxic waste silo within the Power Up chapter).

However, though the screen goes black, the audio’s still working and the HUD is still visible. Basically, everything but the 3D models and textures still works, but other than the HUD, the screen remains black.

This is what I’ve tried:

-mat_specular [0,1]
-mem_force_flush [0,1]
-mat_fullbright [0,1]
-mat_hsv [0,1]
-mat_softwarelighting [0,1]
-flush
-noclip (camera still fails, no matter where I re-enter the map after the door I mentioned earlier)
-restart (which worked as far as I did the level again and didn’t have the problem until I tried to save it, then I came back with the blank screen right from loading, even though I didn’t save on one. I also tried no-clipping to the end after restart. Didn’t fix it.)
-Reinstalling
-Redownloading
-Updated my graphics card (Intel Q965/Q963 Express Chipset Family)

It seems that even though I can get past this error, eventually the black screen of death returns by the next save’s load.

My friend and I have been playing the hell out of Black Mesa and it’s easily the best HL game in the franchise, so let us know what the issue is here so we can finish the damn thing!

PS: I found the pizza.
